SEARCH
Package com.example.event_app.utils

Class AccessibilityHelper

java.lang.Object
com.example.event_app.utils.AccessibilityHelper
public class AccessibilityHelper extends Object
AccessibilityHelper - Manages app-wide accessibility settings Features: - Large text mode (increases all text sizes by 30%) - High contrast mode (enables dark theme) - Larger touch targets (increases button sizes by 50%) User Story: As an entrant, I want accessibility options (e.g., large text, high contrast) Usage: 1. In SettingsActivity: Toggle switches save preferences 2. In every Activity onCreate(): Call applyAccessibilitySettings()

    void
    applyAccessibilitySettings(androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity activity)
    Apply all accessibility settings to an activity Call this in onCreate() of each activity AFTER setContentView(): Example: protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) { super.onCreate(savedInstanceState); setContentView(R.layout.activity_main); // Apply accessibility new AccessibilityHelper(this).applyAccessibilitySettings(this); // Rest of your code...
